videoJson.name: 3/4" U-matic
videoJson.fact1: While this format was primarily used to store analog video, it was also used for the storage of digital audio data
videoJson.fact2: This format was named after the letter U, because the course of the tape running through a playback device is shaped like the letter U
videoJson.fact3: All tapes have a round red button on the back that can be removed to prevent accidental recording
videoJson.fact4: "The first format in a cassette. Many early U-matics do not say U-matic on them." - J.Jay
